intro: Zieria trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaf zieria, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, often in well-drained soils. Zieria trifoliata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local wildlife.
